subject: Productivity
title: The What-the-Hell Effect
description: A short lesson to help you apply The What-the-Hell Effect.

hook.text: A dieter eats one cookie and thinks: I already blew it. Might as well eat the whole box.

buildup.text: Psychologists Janet Polivy and Peter Herman named this the what-the-hell effect in their research on dieting.

discovery.text: One small failure triggers total abandonment. The goal becomes all-or-nothing instead of mostly-on-track.

twist.text: The fix is self-compassion. Treating a slip as data rather than failure prevents the spiral.

climax.text: Kristin Neff's research shows self-compassion after failure improves recovery and future performance.

punchline.text: One bad day isn't failure. Quitting after one bad day is.

quiz.question: What is the what-the-hell effect?
options: Abandoning a goal completely after one small failure
Setting goals that are too ambitious
